oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of God in Jesus Christ Name service, 2002 April 20
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service officiated by Jimmy Morrow with a small number of attendees. Jason Barnes and his sister lead the congregation in song. Glenn Dukes, who is visiting the congregation, handles first one and then two serpents at a time. Jimmy Morrow preaches in melodic tones, expounding on scripture. During the sermon he begins handling a serpent for a short time. The sermon is following by more hymns and the testimony of Rayford Dunn.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern--Religious life and customs; Lay preaching; Pentecostal preaching; Prayer; Singing--Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches)--Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Barnes, Jason; Dukes, Glenn; Dunn, Rayford; Morrow, Jimmy
Edwina Church of God in Jesus Christ's Name (Del Rio, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of God in Jesus Christ Name field recordings, 2002-2004
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson Holiness Churches of Appalachia recordings and interviews
